description.raw:
84b3991 contains proposed changes to the box implementation in response to issue #72. The main change is to remove the extent field from `BoxPrivate`. The extent field is currently used to identify and handle null-extent boxes when combing them with other boxes. For example, a box with null extent + a box with finite extent should produce a box with the same size as the one with finite extent. 84b3991 achieves the desired behavior by initializing the minimum and maximum corners of a box to large (`MAX_D`) and small (`MIN_D`) values respectively, so that when combined with a finite box, the finite box's minimum and maximum corners take precedence over the null-extent box's corners. Issue [#72](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/issues/72/box-initialized-wiht-invalid-extent) has some additional details.

I added a test to the Box unit tests, which sets the corners of a box created with the default constructor using `Min()` and `Max()` and then combines it with another box. This test would fail without the proposed changes to the box implementation.

title: Remove box extent field

The extent field is currently used to identify and handle null-extent boxes when combing them with other boxes. For example, a box with null extent + a box with finite extent should produce a box with the same size as the one with finite extent. 84b3991 achieves the desired behavior by initializing the minimum and maximum corners of a box to large (MAX_D) and small (MIN_D) values respectively, so that when combined with a finite box, the finite box's minimum and maximum corners take precedence over the null-extent box's corners.
